title: Calories in Chocolate Powder
meta_description: Discover calories in chocolate powder per 100g, including carbs, protein, fat, fiber, and quick tweaks for sweetened versions or recipes.
assumptions: Unsweetened cocoa powder, dry, natural process; standard grocery brand.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, processing (Dutch vs. natural), sweetness level, and additives. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of unsweetened chocolate powder has ~228 kcal, high in fiber and antioxidants.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp sugar per serving (15g powder)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tablespoon of chocolate powder?
faqs.a: About 12 kcal for 1 tbsp (5g) unsweetened cocoa powder.

faqs.q: Is chocolate powder high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~20g protein per 100g, making it a good plant-based option.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in chocolate powder?
faqs.a: High at ~37g per 100g, mostly insoluble fiber for digestive health.

faqs.q: Does sweetened chocolate powder have more calories?
faqs.a: Yes, often 400+ kcal per 100g due to added sugars.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in unsweetened chocolate powder?
faqs.a: ~58g per 100g, but mostly from fiber, so net carbs are low (~21g).
